Posts.Content: I was told that with chemo, you can't be a blood and organ donor!
Posts.Title: Death and dying....a hot topic!

Posts.Content: I bought my Breast Cancer book of stamps! They are predicting that in ten years, we will no longer suffer and die from cancer! I guess the molecular-target-therapies are advancing at a rapid rate! It seems so hopeful! Praise God!
Posts.Title: By 2015...

Posts.Content: So glad you are home again, and that everything went well for you. I'm glad that you are sharing the computer so nicely with your sister--it helps us to learn to love better when we share. Offer up your sufferings to the Lord for the salvation of sinners. God bless you, Cathy--you are one of our inspirations and I'll keep you in my prayers! Maggs
Posts.Title: Hello Ladies

Posts.Content: At some point, even if we are not dying right at the moment, we all have to come to terms with the fact that we will die someday. I think it is something we should be able to talk about, since it is unavoidable for everyone, anyway. I have side effects from each drug I take, AND my markers are slowly increasing...chemo almost killed me, so I might be running out of options unless I want to risk it again. Is there anyone out there who is not afraid to die? What do you believe about it, or have experienced from the death of others? I know it is a difficult thing to talk about, but I don't think we should be afraid to support one another even in the face of death. Our society really doesn't talk about it much...
Posts.Title: Hey There Ladies!

Posts.Content: Hey, Cathy, this is truly WONDERFUL news!!! Congrats and keep up the GREAT work! By the way, I found out where the Vineyard community is in Maryland. Please keep praying for me!THANKS!!! Love, Maggs
Posts.Title: Some Good News to Report

Posts.Content: Glad to hear of your good results! Nice to see some familiar people on the board--including Hummingbyrd!
Posts.Title: Why I Have Been MIA

Posts.Content: Governor Robert Ehrlich and the Dept. of Individuals with Disabilities, in conjunction with the MD State Dept. of Education, is enabling me to keep my teacher certification by offering me some options after eight years of tutoring! I wrote LOTS of letters over the past two years about this issue, and his office has responded! All things ARE possible with God! I just wanted to share some truly GREAT news with everyone! Praise God!!! Maggs
Posts.Title: Great News from Maryland

Posts.Content: I finally got fitted at a prosthesis store! They know which bra is the proper fit, and it helped me look a lot better. I am not as concerned about my appearance as other women because for six months or so I didn't wear a bra at all, and I think I shocked a lot of people without even realizing it because I was so grateful just to be alive! Sometimes I still wear a slightly smaller, less expensive lightweight prosthesis and if it is a little off, well, I wear loose-fitting sweaters and tops anyway! Hope this helps!
Posts.Title: Staps!! Any suggestions?
